ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.

What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I developed basic knowledge of sound, acoustics, sound design and sound design for theater. I also explored theories of sound.

I learned how to use Digital Audio Workspaces (DAW) software. I learned how to think about sound as a concept. I learned how to talk about its properties. I learned how it affects my day-to-day life and how it can enhance theatre. I learned how to think through the process of creating and listening to sound.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This course is excellent. Well designed, thoughtfully taught, and engaging. The personal attention Nathan gave was amazing, as was his pedagogical care, ensuring that we each were learning the material and also developing our own ideas and intellectual trajectories in sound design. The material is diverse and interesting, relevant and together forms a good basis of the sound design.

Strengths: The projects are fantastic; the readings are pretty interesting, especially The Dramatic Imagination; the critiques are really thoughtful; and Nathan is such a wonderful and brilliant professor and designer of sound. 

Weakness: I didnt love watching the tutorials on how to use the DAW software in class, which we only did twice or so. Id rather we learn the software on our own then just use class to think though it conceptually, which is what we did the majority of the time and what I preferred.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: There were some difficulties with the distance learning model for a course like this, of course, but Nathan took care to resolve all of them. Overall, the distance learning model of this course was successful.

I think the critiques still worked really well over zoom. Of course, we had to focus directly on sound output from a device rather than in a live space, so the type of aural experience was a bit different than a theatrical one, but nonetheless Id made it easier to really focus on the sound through the headphones. 

I didnt love watching the tutorials on how to use the DAW software in class, which we only did twice or so. Id rather we learn the software on our own then just use class to think though it conceptually, which is what we did the majority of the time and what I preferred. Of course, I wish we could have been in the theatre, but nothing much could be done about that given COVID.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, I would. Anyone interested in sound and theater will benefit.

I would recommend this course to anyone who wants to think about sound, theatre, art, and aural experiences and who wants to do some really cool, fun projects in a supportive and wonderful environment.

Absolutely. Nathan is a phenomenal teacher and mentor. This class helped me not only to learn about sound and greatly improve my own abilities as a designer, but also to understand and appreciate the many other components of a successful theater production. The course is a wonderful mixture of practical advice/application and engaging artistic discussion. Even if you are not a sound designer (many folks in this class were not) its absolutely worth taking. It was supportive, fun and incredibly helpful. I will be referencing discussions I had in this course for years to come. A wonderful experience overall!
